me.ddos.doxel
Class Doxel

java.lang.Object
  me.ddos.doxel.Doxel

public class Doxel
extends Object

Doxel is a simple rendering engine used for rendering scalar data on an aligned grid. This is can be used to render such things as coherent noise. To polygonize the scalar data, the marching cubes algorithm is used by default, but other polygonizers can be used as long as they implement Polygonizer. Noise sources must implement NoiseSource to be used. See the source of DoxelApp (available on GitHub) for an example on how to use this class.

Doxel requires OpenGL 3.2.

Author:
DDoS

Method Detail

create

public static void create(String title,
                          int windowWidth,
                          int windowHeight,
                          float fieldOfView)
Create the render window and basic resources. This excludes the model.

Parameters:
title - The title of the render window.
windowWidth - The width of the render window.
windowHeight - The height of the render window.
fieldOfView - The field of view in degrees. 75 is suggested.

destroy

public static void destroy()
Destroys the render window and its resources.

generateModelMesh

public static void generateModelMesh(float x,
                                     float y,
                                     float z,
                                     float sizeX,
                                     float sizeY,
                                     float sizeZ)
Generates the model's mesh from the noise source using the provided polygonizer. Default noise source is a SimplePerlinNoiseSource with a frequeny of 0.05. Default polygonizer is the MarchingCubesPolygonizer.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the position of the model.
y - The y coordinate of the position of the model.
z - The z coordinate of the position of the model.
sizeX - The size on the x axis of the model.
sizeY - The size on the y axis of the model.
sizeZ - The size on the z axis of the model.

deleteModelMesh

public static void deleteModelMesh()
Delete all the model mesh generated so far.

createModel

public static void createModel()
Creates the model from it's mesh. Must be called after mesh is generated using generateModelMesh(float, float, float, float, float, float).

Throws:
IllegalStateException - If the display wasn't created first. If the mesh wasn't created first. If the model has already been created.

updateModel

public static void updateModel()
Updates the model. Deletes old model resources and creates new ones from the mesh. Does not delete the model mesh.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - If the display wasn't created first. If the mesh wasn't created first.

lightDistanceAttenuationFactor

public static float lightDistanceAttenuationFactor()
Gets the light distance attenuation factor. In other terms, how much distance affects light intensity. Larger values affect it more. 0.12 is the default value.

Returns:
The light distance attenuation factor.

lightDistanceAttenuationFactor

public static void lightDistanceAttenuationFactor(float factor)
Sets the light distance attenuation factor. In other terms, how much distance affects light intensity. Larger values affect it more. 0.12 is the default value.

Parameters:
factor - The light distance attenuation factor.

meshResolution

public static float meshResolution()
Gets the mesh resolution. Used by generateModelMesh(float, float, float, float, float, float). Smaller values mean higher resolution meshes. 0.5 is the default value.

Returns:
The mesh resolution.

meshResolution

public static void meshResolution(float resolution)
Sets the mesh resolution. Used by generateModelMesh(float, float, float, float, float, float). Smaller values mean higher resolution meshes. 0.5 is the default value.

Parameters:
resolution - The mesh resolution.

logic

public static void logic()
The logic part of the rendering cycle. Generates the matrices for model to camera transformation.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - If the display wasn't created first.

render

public static void render()
Displays the current model with the proper rotation and position to the render window.

Throws:
IllegalStateException - If the display wasn't created first. If the model wasn't created first. If the logic wasn't created ran at least once before.
